Issues.Title: TreeNode colors - NotSelectedBackColor, NotSelectedForeColor, SelectedBackColor, SelectedForeColor
Issues.Body:
### Background and motivation

Now, I can customize only main BackColor and ForeColor of not-selected TreeNode. When I select TreeNode, both these colors are changed, and I can not customize BackColor and ForeColor of selected TreeNode. It breaks color scheme of control.

So, current BackColor and ForeColor should be renamed to NotSelectedBackColor and NotSelectedForeColor, that they are in fact. And two new properties should be added: SelectedBackColor and SelectedForeColor.

### API Proposal

```csharp
public
Color
NotSelectedBackColor // Former BackColor
{ get; set; }

public
Color
NotSelectedForeColor // Former ForeColor
{ get; set; }

public
Color
SelectedBackColor // New property
{ get; set; }

public
Color
SelectedForeColor // New property
{ get; set; }
```


### API Usage

```csharp
TreeNode.SelectedForeColor = Color.Green;
```


### Alternative Designs

_No response_

### Risks

I don't see risks.

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

VS Designer need to support the feature
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TreeNode colors - NotSelectedBackColor, NotSelectedForeColor, SelectedBackColor, SelectedForeColor" (#9657)

Issues.Title: Handle `ref` to `in` change
Issues.Body:
A number of Libarary APIs have had their parameters changed from `ref` to `in` (or `readonly ref`).

This change modifies code that we control and disables the "passing ref to in" warning for the interop assembly until we can get https://github.com/microsoft/CsWin32/issues/1014 resolved.

This change requires a more current Roslyn build and as such I've updated it. Note that VS Intellisense does not support this new feature yet. You can filter out intellisense errors by selecting "Build Only" in the error pane in the meantime (this will not remove red squiggles unfortunately).

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9654)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Handle `ref` to `in` change" (#9654)

Issues.Title: BorderColor property
Issues.Body:
### Background and motivation

Now, I can customize only presence of border, but not color. For customizing, it would be cool to have property BorderColor. For example, in Button or Panel.

### API Proposal

```csharp
public
Color
BorderColor
{ get; set; }
```


### API Usage

```csharp
Panel.BorderColor = Color.Black;
```


### Alternative Designs

_No response_

### Risks

I don't see risks. The color is set inside realization, or is taken from system settings. The only difference - it will be rised up to user for customization.

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

VS Designer need to support the feature.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "BorderColor property" (#9656)

Issues.Title: Enumerators of DataGridView.Rows and DataGridView.Columns return object, not DataGridViewRow and DataGridViewColumn
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

7

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

Indexers of DataGridView.Rows and DataGridView.Columns return DataGridViewRow and DataGridViewColumn. But enumerators - return object. Can it be something other than DataGridViewRow and DataGridViewColumn? Unconvinient. If I use foreach cycle, I have to make cast.

### Steps to reproduce

Write it in VS:

```
foreach (var Variable in DataGridView.Rows)
{
    // The type of Variable is object
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Enumerators of DataGridView.Rows and DataGridView.Columns return object, not DataGridViewRow and DataGridViewColumn" (#9655)

Issues.Title: Merge from main into feature/9.0  08/03
Issues.Body:
Since GH does not merge this change correctly, I ran git merge locally:

git fetch --all --prune
git checkout feature/9.0
git checkout -b merge-from-main-8-3
git merge upstream/main 
git status
build
Observed that there are no conflicts, including files flagged by the GH in the automatic merge attempt
git push -u origin merge-from-main-8-3

Issues.Title: C++/CLI compile error C3611 for "gcnew System::Windows::Forms::DataObject"
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET8 preview6

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

It works in .NET6&7

### Issue description

I'm not sure if it belongs to winform, maybe it's a bug of c++/cli compiler since these code compile well if rewrite with C#.

To reproduce the error, just create a new project in VS, add following attributes in vcxproj:

```
  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>net8.0-windows</TargetFramework>
    <CLRSupport>NetCore</CLRSupport>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <FrameworkReference Include="Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App.WindowsForms" />
  </ItemGroup>
```

Compile following code, then we can see compile error C3611: a sealed function cannot have a pure-specifier
```
void HelloWorld()
{
    gcnew System::Windows::Forms::DataObject();
}
```

BTW I suspect it's a c++/cli compiler bug because I have encountered it in https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/pull/88840#issuecomment-1637657944, this comment also provides another sample. Please help forward this problem to right person if you treat it as a compiler bug. Thanks!

### Steps to reproduce

see description
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "C++/CLI compile error C3611 for "gcnew System::Windows::Forms::DataObject"" (#9644)

Issues.Title: Fix bugs in ResourceCodeDomSerializer.SerializationResourceManager
Issues.Body:
As discussed in #9457.

#8332 introduced bugs in `ResourceCodeDomSerializer.SerializationResourceManager`, in method `GetResourceSet`. When we fail to get a resource reader, the original code used to return a resource set for the invariant culture, and null otherwise. After #8332,,

- we're returning `null` the first time we fill the `ResourceTable` cache
- for the non-invariant culture case, we started filling the `ResourceTable` cache with a static dictionary,  which looks like a pretty big issue

These bugs were introduced in .Net 8 and we still have a chance to fix them before the release

@dreddy-work, @elachlan 

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9642)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix bugs in ResourceCodeDomSerializer.SerializationResourceManager" (#9642)

Issues.Title: Fix a few more ref counts in ActiveXImpl
Issues.Body:
This is the last audit change of `ActiveXImpl`. Changes were vetted against docs and MFC implementations.

- `QuickActivate`` was releasing pointers it shouldn't have been.
- `SetAdvise` and `GetAdvise` were not AddRef'ing appropriately.
- Update comments.

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Update file header for PrintDialogDesigner.cs" (#9635)

Issues.Title: ActiveXImpl.QuickActivate has a dependency on COM interop IConnectionPointContainer
Issues.Body:
[The code here](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/c0ac1f1723e6cd67563d0c979842ae3c1609fd44/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/Control.ActiveXImpl.cs#L1412) leverages the auto-generated `IConnectionPointContainer` from COM interop. If built-in COM interop is not available we'll have to figure how to replace this.

In this particular case it is only done for user controls, but we probably will need to provide this functionality in general for Control. I'm not sure how prevalent this is for our users that would want to use AOT.

cc: @AaronRobinsonMSFT @lonitra
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ActiveXImpl.QuickActivate has a dependency on COM interop IConnectionPointContainer" (#9633)

Issues.Title: Use AdviseHolder in ActiveXImpl
Issues.Body:
This change is the first of a series that is auditing and documenting our ActiveX control usages.

Our handling of Advise/Unadvise wasn't properly ref counting. MFC just uses the Windows provided IOleAdviseHolder, this change does the same.

This change also adds a number of inheritdoc tags to pick up the documentation generated by CSWin32, Note that the interface names don't always match as the documentation is only on the base interface.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9632)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Use AdviseHolder in ActiveXImpl" (#9632)

Issues.Title: Add commentary to TextRenderer assert
Issues.Body:
This assert has come up a number of times recently. Adding some informational text to clarify why this assert exists and what the guidelines are.
